cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.DM. 

The paper deals with the algebraic theory behind the constructions of locally decodable codes (LDCs) and their applications in query complexity and private information retrieval (PIR) schemes. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including Information Theory (cs.IT), Cryptography and Security (cs.CR), Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS), Computational Complexity (cs.CC), and Discrete Mathematics (cs.DM).
